quote: It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus
meaning: We cannot control events, only our response to them.
subject: resilience

quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius
meaning: Obstacles can become opportunities for growth.
subject: perseverance

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde
meaning: Authenticity matters more than imitation.
subject: identity

quote: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi
meaning: Pain can be transformative and lead to growth.
subject: healing

quote: You don’t win friends with salad.
author: Homer J. Simpson
meaning: Sometimes we fool ourselves with effort that doesn’t work socially.
subject: humour

quote: Save me, Jebus!
author: Homer J. Simpson
meaning: Even those without belief may call for help in crisis.
subject: humour

quote: The majority of the Irish people are mentally unsound.
author: Myles na gCopaleen (Flann O’Brien)
meaning: A biting satirical comment on Irish society.
subject: Irish wit

quote: One chance is plenty, if you don’t waste it.
author: Proinnseas Ó hÉalaithe
meaning: Don’t wait for endless opportunities; the one in front of you is enough.
subject: resilience

quote: Co nagle, to po diable.
author: Polish Proverb
meaning: Rushed work leads to mistakes.
subject: patience

quote: Nie chwal dnia przed zachodem słońca.
funetic: Nia chaval dina fished sa-hoe-them swanka
author: Polish Proverb
meaning: Don’t judge something before it is finished.
subject: caution
